responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: "Reflected cross-site scripting in tests/bad_full.html"
    analysis: |
      The `tests/bad_full.html` file contains an inline JavaScript script (`<script>alert('script-onload');</script>`)
      and an event handler attribute (`<body onload="alert('body-onload');">`) that execute arbitrary JavaScript.
      If an attacker can control the HTML rendered by the application through user input, they can
      inject their own malicious script payloads into the page.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - tests/bad_full.html
    classification: very promising

  - headline: "Undocumented/custom tags in tests/bad_full.html"
    analysis: |
      The `tests/bad_full.html` file contains an undocumented or custom HTML tag (`<foo>Foo Tag</foo>`).
      Depending on how the application parses and handles this tag, it may lead to vulnerabilities
      like cross-site scripting if user input is unsanitized and embedded into the rendered HTML output.
    cwe: CWE-116
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - tests/bad_full.html
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Reflected cross-site scripting in tests/bad_full.html
leads.analysis:
The tests/bad_full.html file contains an inline JavaScript script (<script>alert('script-onload');</script>)
and an event handler attribute (<body onload="alert('body-onload');">) that execute arbitrary JavaScript.
If an attacker can control the HTML rendered by the application through user input, they can
inject their own malicious script payloads into the page.

leads.headline: Undocumented/custom tags in tests/bad_full.html
leads.analysis:
The tests/bad_full.html file contains an undocumented or custom HTML tag (<foo>Foo Tag</foo>).
Depending on how the application parses and handles this tag, it may lead to vulnerabilities
like cross-site scripting if user input is unsanitized and embedded into the rendered HTML output.
